p: The blame for this spread is distributed both to the industrialised, wealthy nations and to poor African countries. The West is implied as not doing enough for Africans, mobilising quickly and effectively only when their own citizens are infected. In contrast, the poor African countries are seen as kindling the virus because their compromised infrastructure further spreads the disease. This leads to blaming the affected countries and their populace, creating an ‘us’ (enlightened and civilised persons) versus ‘them’ (primitive Africans) mentality.
